subject: Mental Health
title: Diet Culture as a Risk Factor
description: A micro-lesson that makes Diet Culture as a Risk Factor usable.

hook.text: The $72 billion diet industry profits from the same behaviors eating disorders punish.

buildup.text: Diet culture glorifies restriction, labels foods as good or bad, and moralizes body size.

discovery.text: Research shows dieting in adolescence increases eating disorder risk fivefold.

twist.text: Many eating disorders begin as diets that were praised by family, friends, and doctors.

climax.text: The line between disordered eating and a normal diet is thinner than we admit.

punchline.text: When a culture celebrates restriction, disorders hide in plain sight.

quiz.question: How much does adolescent dieting increase eating disorder risk?
